thread.section_title: Business Breaking News | Finance & Business News | News.com.au
thread.title: Reffind enjoys solid market debut

author: news.com.au
title: Reffind enjoys solid market debut
text:
THE developer of a smartphone app to help keep large companies in touch with staff has enjoyed a solid start to trading on the share market.
SHARES in Reffind began trading at 24.5 cents at 1100 AEST, a premium to the 20 cents they were issued at as part of an $8 million public offer.
By the close of trade they were worth 26 cents, a gain of 30 per cent on the issue price, and valuing the company at $12.4 million. Reffind says the way many businesses communicate with workers - via email, voicemail, presentations, video feeds and training sessions - is outdated and often ineffective. The company says its app makes communication easier, delivering content to staff in short form on mobile platforms, in a fun and "gamified" manner. The app is designed to be used by medium and large companies, and allows messages from management to be delivered to smartphones at any time of the day. "We've only scratched the surface in terms of potential customers with excellent feedback to date," Reffind managing director Jamie Pride said. Reffind products have already been taken up by Coles, AMP, Coca-Cola, Lion, Fuji Xerox and Pacific Brands. Funds raised from the share offer will be used by Reffind for expansion into the US, and the development of its sales, marketing and systems.
